grantors.title: Grantors
grantors.description: Usually the owners of the collateral property (the 'grantors' of the security instrument) are also the borrowers for the transaction, but the two are not necessarily the same. It is possible to have borrowers who own no collateral property. It is also possible to have collateral property that is owned (perhaps in part) by parties who are not named as borrowers on the transaction. The latter are sometimes referred to as 'non-borrower property owners'. Because the information collected for

trustVestingName.title: Full Trust Name -- include name of trustee(s) and their title(s).

formationState.title: State of Formation
formationState.description: The state of formation or organization for certain kinds of entities.

isPowerOfAttorney.title: Is Grantor using a Power of Attorney to Sign?

attorneyInFact.title: Attorney-in-Fact
attorneyInFact.usage: Only used if entityType == 'individual' && isPowerOfAttorney == true

isTranslator.title: Does this Grantor require a translator?

isForeignNational.title: Is the Grantor a Foreign National??

complexSigners.title: Signers for Grantor (complex)
complexSigners.description: This array collects the signers for this Grantor.

items.description: This object contains the attributes that make up a signer of a document. This object is used on multiple levels for the signers.

isTranslator.title: Translator Required?
isTranslator.usage: Only used if entityType == 'individual' for this particular complex signer.

signers.title: Signers for Signers for Grantor
signers.description: Second level of nesting. This array collects the signers for signers for this Grantor.

items.description: This object contains the attributes that make up a signer of a document. This object is used on each of three possible levels for the signers.

isTranslator.title: Translator Required?
isTranslator.usage: Only needed if entityType == 'individual' for this signer.

signers.title: Signers for Signers for Signers for Grantor
signers.description: At this third level of nesting, we assume that the following signers are individuals.

items.description: This object contains the attributes that make up a signer of a document, except at this third level, the signers are individuals only.

owners.title: Owners for Signers for Signers for Grantor
owners.description: This array is for Owners for Signers for Signers for Grantor. At this level, individuals only.

items.description: This object contains the attributes that make up an owner as individual for signers for signers for Grantor.

owners.description: This array is for Owners for Signers for Grantor. Second-level.
owners.title: Owners for Signers for Grantor

signers.title: Signers for Owners for Signers for Grantor
signers.usage: At this level of nesting, we assume that the following signers are individuals.

complexOwners.title: Owners for Grantor (complex)
complexOwners.usage: Only relevant if enableFeatures.enableEntityOwnership == true. To use this, 'usesComplexSigners': true must also be sent as a property of each Grantor. Should be used in combination with complexSigners.
complexOwners.description: A more complex interface for sending owner information for an entity. This array collects the owners for this Grantor.

items.description: This object contains the attributes that make up an owner. This object is used on multiple levels for the owners.

signers.title: Signers for Owners for Grantor
signers.description: Second level of nesting. This array collects the owners for this Grantor.

items.description: This object contains the attributes that make up an owner. This object is used on multiple levels for the owners.

signers.title: Signers for Signers for Owners for Grantor
signers.description: At this level of signers, we assume that they are individuals.

transactionID.title: Transaction ID
transactionID.usage: CONFIGURATION. OPTIONAL. You can use this key to send an ID to identify this transaction within your system. The user never sees it in the interview and IT DOES NOT AFFECT THE DOCUMENTS IN ANY WAY. If a value is sent it will be included with the transaction information you receive for billing.

isCheckData.title: Produce a file to check for missing answers?
isCheckData.usage: This produces 'CheckData.txt' (along with the other documents produced by the app), which can be checked for information about missing values. NOTE: This property does not correspond with any control in the interview users interact with. Regular users are not able to turn it off on their own.

isTestFile.title: CREATE AS TEST FILE?
isTestFile.usage: Makes the file a test file. Test files are not billed by Lightning Docs. Using this feature for real transactions is a violation of the Lightning Docs license agreement.

customWorkItemName.title: Work Item Name
customWorkItemName.description: Due to file system limitations, any slashes (/) will be replaced with hyphen (-).

loanProduct.title: Loan Type
loanProduct.description: Some users have client-specific language in the documents that varies depending on the type of loan (e.g., 'Bridge' or 'Rental'). That loan type or product name can be submitted to this property. While users filling the online form would see a dropdown list of choices to select from, those choices vary from user to user so they cannot be provided here.

isLineOfCredit.title: Is this a Line of Credit?

lineOfCreditTransactionSelection.title: Is this the first transaction or subsequent transaction?

isBuildingLoanStandalone.title: Will the building loan be a standalone transaction?
isBuildingLoanStandalone.usage: CONFIGURATION. This is only used with the NYBuildingLoan app.
isBuildingLoanStandalone.description: If you are only advancing funds related to construction and do not intend to make another loan for another purpose (e.g., refinancing an existing loan or purchasing the subject property) you should indicate 'Yes'.  If you are advancing funds for another purpose, you will need to indicate 'No' and create the additional document set using the Master Loan application.

isDoubleDouble.title: Is this loan part of the Double-Double product?

isProxy.title: Do you want to build the loan documents using another company's customizations?
isProxy.usage: CONFIGURATION. CLIENT SPECIFIC. Optional. Under some circumstances, some users choose to have a transaction assemble using the special customizations of a different Lightning Docs user.

proxyUser.title: Select a company
proxyUser.usage: CONFIGURATION. Needed if isProxy == true. Allows you to identify the specific company whose customizations will be used for this transaction. The options are specific to each Lightning Docs user, so they cannot be given here.

clientName.title: Client Name
clientName.usage: CONFIGURATION. THIS IS ONLY USED IN API INTEGRATION DEVELOPMENT AND TESTING. Allows you to replicate client-specific conditions outside that client's Lightning Docs catalog. Contact Lightning Docs if you need to know which name to use to simulate a particular client.

isNoScenario.title: Remove the ability of the user to select a scenario for this record?
isNoScenario.usage: CONFIGURATION. This property does not correspond to one available in the questionnaire. It tells the application that a scenario has already been selected for this record so that the user is not allowed to select. This allows you to avoid situations where the user is overwriting data you sent with that stored in a selected scenario.

scenarioName.title: Scenario Title
scenarioName.usage: CONFIGURATION. Optional. This can be used (optionally) with isNoScenario to fill the label that appears at the top of the questionnaire telling the user which scenario was selected. It is untrue, in that no scenario was selected, but it can be useful to provide information about the type of product in use or the assumptions that were made in your data. E.g. 'Rental Loan' or 'Fix and Flip'. It's just a label seen in the questionnaire, so using this (or declining to use it) cannot change anything of substance.

enableFeatures.description: This object contains properties that allow you to enable features normally not viewable by the user. It does NOT, on its own, control whether or not a given loan feature is actually on or off for the transaction. The following loan features are UNAVAILABLE by default. Make features available to the user by making the appropriate value 'true'. (It is best practice to enable visibility for any features to be used in a given transaction). Generally speaking these features should only be enabled after consultation with Geraci LLP legal counsel.

enableLenderReserve.title: Enable Generic Lender Reserve
enableLenderReserve.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether the lender will withhold funds as a generic lender holdback subject to a variety of conditions that the user MANUALLY enters. The actual language will be entered into the Loan Agreement and REQUIRES MANUAL EDITING by the user before the documents can be provided to the Borrower.

enablePropertyTaxReserve.title: Enable Property Tax Reimbursement Reserve
enablePropertyTaxReserve.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether the lender will withhold funds from the loan proceeds in the amount entered to be used to pay property taxes through the Maturity Date of the loan. The Borrower is required to pay property taxes first and can then seek these funds to be released from the loan servicer. This is NOT an impound account. Users should select 'Are there any tax/insurance or other impounds?' within the Special Loan Features section if they intend on including tax impounds.

enablePropertyInsuranceReserve.title: Enable Property Insurance Reimbursement Reserve
enablePropertyInsuranceReserve.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether the lender will withhold funds from the loan proceeds in the amount entered to be used to pay property insurance through the Maturity Date of the loan. The borrower is required to pay property insurance first and can then seek these funds to be released from the loan servicer. This is NOT an impound account. Users should select 'Are there any tax/insurance or other impounds?' within the Special Loan Features section if they intend on including insurance impounds.

enableCapExReserve.title: Enable Capital Expenditure (CapEx) Reserves
enableCapExReserve.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to include a Capital Expenditure Reserve. A CapEx reserve is typically used for multifamily and/or commercial real estate loans. It's money set aside specifically to pay for things like buying new equipment or making major repairs or improvements to the property. Lenders sometimes require borrowers to create and fund a CapEx reserve as a way to ensure that the property stays in good shape and continues to be a good investment. If this option is selected, a borrower may request funds once per month from the lender for these purposes.

enableAppraisalReserve.title: Enable Appraisal Reserve
enableAppraisalReserve.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to include an Appraisal Reserve. This is used if the lender is relying on an After Repair Value (ARV), and an appraisal will not be completed prior to loan closing. The reserve funds will be released to the borrower assuming the borrower has obtained an appraisal showing the minimum ARV meets or exceeds the amount determined by the user. If not, Lender may retain the portion of the reserve necessary to keep the ARV ratio below 70%.

enableDefaultReserve.title: Enable Default Reserve
enableDefaultReserve.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to include a Default Reserve. In the event that your borrower defaults on the loan, the lender has the right to use the reserved funds to cover the costs of a) making required interest payments, 2) making protective advances, or 3) paying down the principal amount.

enableOccupancyReserve.title: Enable an Occupancy Reserve
enableOccupancyReserve.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to include an Occupancy Reserve. If the borrower intends or the lender requires the borrower to vacate tenants from the collateral property, the lender can withhold funds from the loan proceeds at the time of funding. If the tenants vacate the property and surrender possession of the property back to the owner, prior to the date entered by the user, these funds will be delivered to the borrower.

enableImprovementReserve.title: Enable a Tenant Improvement Reserve
enableImprovementReserve.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to include a Tenant Improvement Reserve. A Tenant Improvement Reserve (aka TI Reserve) is typically used for commercial real estate loans. It's money set aside specifically for tenant improvement projects or updates the borrower (as a landlord) is obligated to complete for their tenant.

enableTerminationFee.title: Enable Termination Fee
enableTerminationFee.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to include a Termination Fee. A Termination Fee is similar to an Exit Fee, except the fee is automatically waived if no Event of Default occurs during the loan term and the borrower repays the entire loan at maturity. This fee is often used to incentivize the borrower to repay the loan and is used in lieu or in addition to charging default interest. The fee may be unenforceable.

enableDeferredBrokerFees.title: Enable the option to Defer a Broker Fee
enableDeferredBrokerFees.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to defer the Broker Fee to be paid at loan maturity instead of at loan origination.

enableSBALoan.title: Enable SBA Loan Documentation
enableSBALoan.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether the loan is an SBA loan with corresponding SBA loan documentation. Additional language and documents are added.

enablePropertyManagement.title: Enable Assignment of Property Management Agreement
enablePropertyManagement.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to include a new document for the borrower, lender, and property manager to sign which, among other things, requires the property manager to agree that their fees owed by borrower are junior in priority to the borrower's payments under the loan.

enableLeaseholdMortgage.title: Enable Leasehold Mortgage
enableLeaseholdMortgage.description: This option allows the user to select whether a certain property is leased by the borrower rather than owned, meaning the mortgage will be a 'Leasehold Mortgage' - that is, the mortgage secures the borrower's rights under their lease and not the ownership of the property itself. This is more often used in commercial real estate, or for residential property in certain limited geographic locations where leaseholds are more common. This selection will add additional language to the loan documents and produce a recommendation for two additional documents: Ground Lease Estoppel and Leasehold Mortgage Agreement. These documents should be executed in advance of closing and must be produced separately. Please contact an attorney for assistance.

enableCannabis.title: Permit Cannabis Related Activity
enableCannabis.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to include provisions permitting cannabis related activity at the property. When enabled, this option adds language to the loan agreement which requires borrower to promise to not operate its cannabis related business until it has all applicable licenses or permits.

enableAffiliate.title: Enable Loan to Affiliate of Lender
enableAffiliate.description: This option is reserved for when the lender and borrower are affiliates of one another. Selecting this feature in the interview will remove instructions to obtain a title policy and all other loan documents (including personal guaranties) other than the Loan Agreement, Note, and Mortgage. Please consult with the Lightning Docs team before using this option as it eliminates serious protections for the Lender and is not to be used for a customary arms-length transaction.

enableLockbox.title: Enable Rental Income Lockbox Language
enableLockbox.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to include a Rental Income Lockbox account in which the rent received by the borrower as the landlord of the property are deposited into an account mutually controlled by the borrower and the lender. Utilizing this feature will require additional documentation and coordination with the chosen bank. Once enabled, there are 3 further options: Hard Lockbox, Soft Lockbox, and Springing Lockbox.

enableUCC.title: Enable Access to UCCs (Equity Pledges and Collateral Security Agreements)
enableUCC.description: This option enables the user to create Collateral Security Agreements, Equity Pledge Agreements, and separately recordable Fixture Filings. Collateral Security Agreements are used for securing personal property in addition to the real property as additional collateral. Equity Pledge Agreements are used for securing ownership interests in a company (typically the borrower) as additional collateral. Fixture Filings are used to provide additional assurance that personal property affixed to the real estate is secured as collateral as well.

enableGrantors.title: Permit Non-Borrower Property Owners
enableGrantors.description: Enabling this option allows the user on a loan by loan basis to enter owners of properties who are not going also the borrowers under the loan. For example, if a trust owns the property but the individual trustees are the borrowers. The Non-Borrower Property Owners are liable under the mortgage but not the payment obligations under the loan itself.

enableSPE.title: Enable Borrower to be a Special Purpose Entity
enableSPE.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether the lender requires the borrower to be a Special Purpose Entity and to include certain provisions to the loan documents. When required in the loan documents, this option adds additional events of default if borrower were to make any changes to the entity structure, or enter into certain other contracts. If the user further selects a 'Permit Borrower to use Recycled SPE' then additional language is added as borrower representations about the existence and financial and legal status of the entity.

enableTenancyInCommonAgreement.title: Enable Tenant In Common Agreement Subordination
enableTenancyInCommonAgreement.description: Enabling this permission will allow you to select, on a loan by loan basis, whether all of the owners of the properties are Co-Tenants subject to a written Tenant in Common Agreement, and you wish for this Agreement to be subordinated to Lender's rights and for the Co-Tenants to make additional promises for the benefit of Lender.

enableNoFillCertNonOwner.title: Enable No-Fill Certification of Non-Owner Occupancy
enableNoFillCertNonOwner.description: The loan documents ordinarily come with a Certification of Non-Owner Occupancy that requires the borrower to hand-write their primary residence address into the certification and certify that the collateral property is not their primary residence. This is done to provide better evidence the borrower does not and will not live in the property. Enabling this option allows you to select on a loan by loan basis whether to require the borrower to hand-write their address into the certification. Using this option provides LESS legal protection than the default documents.

enableNoFillBusinessPurpose.title: Enable No-Fill Business Purpose of Loan Certification
enableNoFillBusinessPurpose.description: The loan documents ordinarily come with a Certification of Business Purpose that requires the borrower to hand-write how they will use the loan proceeds and certify that none of the proceeds are to be used for any consumer purposes into the certification. This is done to provide better evidence the borrower is not using the loan funds for an impermissible purpose. Enabling this option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to remove the hand-written requirement and instead make the form into a form that the borrower only needs to sign and not complete. Using this option provides LESS legal protection than the default documents.

enableRemoveArbitration.title: Enable removal of Arbitration Provisions
enableRemoveArbitration.description: The standard loan documents include a requirement for mandatory arbitration for any type of claim other than the foreclosure of the property which must be performed as required under the mortgage/deed of trust. By selecting 'Yes' to this question, the user can remove the Arbitration Agreement as well as all references to mandatory arbitration for claims other than foreclosure. Even though the arbitration is considered mandatory, more often than not the parties still choose to use the court process and only use the Arbitration language to further protect the lender by threatening the borrower to move all claims to an arbitration. We recommend consulting with counsel prior to removing Arbitration language.

enableRemoveLanguageCapacity.title: Enable removal of English Language Capacity Declaration
enableRemoveLanguageCapacity.description: The default loan documents include a Language Capacity Declaration which requires each signer of the loan documents to prove that they are fluent in the english language by hand-writing a short statement to that effect. Enabling this option allows the user to select whether to remove this document on a loan by loan basis. Using this feature provides LESS legal protection than the default loan documents.

enableRemoveInitials.title: Enable the removal of initial lines in the footer of documents
enableRemoveInitials.description: By default, the Loan Agreement, Promissory Note, and Mortgage include initial lines in the footers of the documents for the parties to initial each page to establish the documents as true originals. Enabling this option allows the user to select whether the initial lines should populate or not on a loan by loan basis.

enableDSCR.title: Include a Debt Service Coverage Ratio Requirement and Event of Default
enableDSCR.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to include a Debt Service Coverage Ratio requirement. For rental properties or other cash flowing real estate, certain mortgage lenders require the borrower to maintain a minimum Debt Service Coverage Ratio for the life of the loan and the failure to maintain this ratio is an Event of Default under the Loan Documents.

enableCompletionGuaranty.title: Enable Third-Party Construction Completion Guaranty
enableCompletionGuaranty.description: If the loan includes a construction holdback and the user includes a guaranty as part of the interview, construction completion requirements automatically populate in the personal guaranty for that guarantor. This option is only to be used when a THIRD PARTY to the transaction (i.e. someone other than any guarantors) are also obligated to complete construction at the property. An additional stand-alone guaranty of completion will be produced for that third party.

enableScheduleOfProperties.title: Enable attaching a list of properties instead of manually entering properties
enableScheduleOfProperties.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to have the documents refer to the properties in an attached list. This feature is most often used when there are numerous properties securing the loan. The use of this feature is to keep the loan documents from becoming too cluttered with large lists of properties. Full property addresses do not need to be entered in the interview, but the state and county must still be entered for each property to determine how many mortgages must be produced. The user must manually enter or otherwise attach property addresses into the blank-provided schedules after the documents are produced. This selection will also produce a requirement for a Proforma title policy and will not allow manual entry of endorsements to add or title exceptions to delete.

enableSignerWarning.title: Enable including a coverpage for all documents that require initials or completion
enableSignerWarning.description: Certain documents require initials between paragraphs within the document such as the Loan Agreement, Note, and Mortgage/Deed of Trust. Other documents require the borrower complete the document in their own handwriting such as the Certificate of Non-Owner Occupancy, Business Purpose Certificate, and Language Capacity Declaration. Enabling this feature will permit the user on a loan by loan basis to insert a coverpage to these documents alerting the notary that these documents cannot just be signed but additional entries in the documents must be done.

enableRemoveCertificates.title: Enable removal of all Entity Certificates
enableRemoveCertificates.description: An Entity Certificate is a document that each party which is an entity or trust will sign along with the other loan documents which sets forth certain additional representations about their authority to enter into and sign the loan documents. This option allows you to select whether to exclude these certificates on a loan by loan basis. Using this feature will provide LESS legal protection than the default loan documents.

enableRemoveTitlePolicy.title: Enable removal of title insurance policy
enableRemoveTitlePolicy.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to exclude instructions related to obtaining a lender's title insurance policy for the loan. We do not recommend using this option.

enableFirstPaymentLetter.title: Enable adding a First Payment Letter
enableFirstPaymentLetter.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to include a First Payment Letter - an additional and separate document which specifies the amount of the very first payment on the loan and the date of which monthly payments begin. This feature is often used for DSCR loans when the lender would like to include references to tax and insurance impounds in addition to the principal and interest payments.

enableDeferredOriginationFees.title: Enable the option to defer an Origination Fee
enableDeferredOriginationFees.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to defer the Origination Fee to be paid at loan maturity instead of at loan origination.

enableEntityOwnership.title: Enter Owners (Members/Shareholders) of Entity Borrowers & Guarantors
enableEntityOwnership.description: By default, the interview only asks for the signers (typically Managers and Officers) of entities for purposes of creating the loan documents. This option adds the ability to add owner information (typically Members and Shareholders) for each borrower or guarantor entity. Choosing this option will then modify the default Entity Certificate to have the owners of the entity certify the signers are authorized to sign and will be signed by all of the members versus the default option which has the signers verify they have the authority to sign the documents.

enableReviewChecklistDoc.title: Automatically Produce a 'QC Review Checklist' document
enableReviewChecklistDoc.description: Enabling this permission does not enable or disable an actual question in the interview. Rather, simply having this permission enabled will produce a 'Review Checklist' document in the document stack. This document will show: Governing Law; Arbitration County; Default Rate; Borrower(s) name, address and their signature block; the Security Instrument signature block; the Guarantor(s) name, address, and signature block; and Entity Certificate signature block (if any). The purpose of this document is to help a QA/QC party to review the documents for accuracy because if any of this information is inaccurate in the checklist it will also be inaccurate in the loan documents.

enableBorrowerCertification.title: Enable adding Borrower Release of Data Form
enableBorrowerCertification.description: This option allows the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether to include a separate 'Borrower Certification and Authorization' form. This document requires the borrower to certify that they understand lender may verify any information provided to it. Lender can share this information with third parties including investors. The borrower also authorizes the sharing of this information and to receive phone, text, and email communications.

enableLegalDescription.title: Manually Enter the Legal Description of the Property
enableLegalDescription.description: This option will allow you to type or copy/paste the legal description into the interview so it will populate in the loan documents. We do not recommend you use this functionality. If you make an error in copying the legal description, or if the description contains inaccurate information, there is a possibility that you will have problems enforcing a title claim. Instead, we recommend that you require the title company to insert the legal property description into the loan document set, as they are the party who is insuring the accuracy of the legal description, and will thus become liable for resolving any issues that may arise due to inaccuracy.

enableAutoExtension.title: Enable adding Automatic Extension Language
enableAutoExtension.description: This option will allow you to select on a loan by loan basis whether to include an automatic extension of the maturity date. There can only be one (1) automatic extension, but the length of the extension, the fee charged (if any), and the increase in the interest rate (if any) may be determined by the user. This option is only compatible with interest-only loans with a fixed interest rate.

enableCollateralAssignment.title: Enable Modification to Loan Assignment to Collateral Assignment of Loan
enableCollateralAssignment.description: This option will allow you to select on a loan by loan basis whether the sale and assignment of the loan to an investor is being made as collateral for an underlying obligation between the seller (assignor) and the purchaser (assignee). This option is typically used when the loan is being assigned to a warehouse lender and the Assignment is not being made as a 'true' assignment of the loan but rather solely for collateral purposes.

enableIntercreditorAgreement.title: Enable Loan Subordinations / Intercreditor Agreements
enableIntercreditorAgreement.description: This option will allow you to select on a loan by loan basis whether to include a Loan Subordination Agreement / Intercreditor Agreement. A loan subordination/intercreditor agreement is used when there are multiple loans secured by the same property and the lenders choose to enter into an agreement confirming their rights between each other. You may further choose between language types that are either more friendly to a senior lender or more friendly to a junior lender.

enableInterestCalcType.title: User can Change Interest Calculation Type between 30/360 - Actual/360 and Actual/365
enableInterestCalcType.description: This option turns on the ability to select between three interest calculation methods: 30/360, Actual/360, and Actual/365.Normally monthly payments are established by creating a fictitious year of 360 days with even 30-day months. The payments are always the same each month even though there are a different number of actual days in each month. This is considered the standard method to calculate monthly payments. DSCR loans should always use 30/360. Some bridge lenders prefer to charge a daily interest rate and they can do so in one of two ways: Actual/360: Instead of dividing the year into 30-day months, this method takes the yearly payment divided by 360 days and charges the daily amount each day so that the payments in a 30-day month are different than a 31-day month. Doing so will charge the borrower 5 extra days of interest each year. OR Actual/365: In this method, the annual payment is divided by 365 days and similar to 360/Actual, the monthly payments will change based on how many calendar days are in each month. The actual amount paid over the year is the same as 30/360.

enableShtarIska.title: Enable Shtar Iska (Heter Iska)
enableShtarIska.description: A Shtar Iska/Heter Iska is a Jewish religious compliance document that allows lenders and borrowers who are both Jewish to comply with Jewish law that prohibits the payment and acceptance of interest on loans between Jewish people. This option allows you to select on a loan-by-loan basis whether to include this form.

enableWorkItemName.title: Allow for custom work item names
enableWorkItemName.description: This feature will only be accessible from within an actual interview. To give a custom name to your scenario, simply fill out the Scenario Title field.

enableRemoveCognovit.title: Enable Removal of Confession of Judgment Provisions
enableRemoveCognovit.description: The default loan documents will automatically include Confession of Judgment Provisions if the Property State and the Governing Law State match and are any of: Delaware, Illinois, Maryland, Ohio, Pennsylvania, or Virginia. By enabling this permission the user on a loan by loan basis will be able to remove the Confession of Judgment Provisions in the loan documents. Using this feature provides LESS legal protection than the default loan documents.

enableBridgeToPerm.title: Enable Bridge to Perm loan
enableBridgeToPerm.description: Normally a borrower would first take out a Bridge/Fix and Flip/Construction loan, then stabilize the property and complete any construction. Once the property is stabilized, typically with a tenant in place, that same borrower typically seeks permanent lower cost financing usually through the form of a DSCR loan. This feature combines both loan features into a single loan. An initial bridge loan which is interest-only, and typically contains a construction period, which then automatically converts to a 30 year perm loan. Enabling this feature allows the user to select on a loan-by-loan basis to utilize line of credit documentation rather than a closed end loan with a fixed amount advanced at closing.

enableInterestRateStep.title: Enable Interest Rate Step Up
enableInterestRateStep.description: Enabling this permission will show 'Will the interest rate automatically increase during the loan term (Step Up)?' in the loan interview under the Standard Loan Terms page. Users will determine on a loan-by-loan basis whether to use this feature if enabled. The feature is used when a lender would like the interest rate to change after a fixed time period during the loan and the lender knows the exact rate they would like the Note to change to (i.e. from 6% fixed to 9% fixed after 3 months). Note that even with this permission on, interest rate step is still incompatible with variable rate loans, and will thus be hidden in the interview if variable rate is selected.

enableNonDutchAll.title: Enable Non-Dutch Accrual of Interest for All Reserves
enableNonDutchAll.description: Lender can choose to charge interest only on the amounts advanced to the borrower, commonly referred to as non-dutch interest, or the lender can choose to charge interest on the entire loan amount, commonly referred to as dutch interest. Enable this option if lender is only charging interest on amounts advanced to the borrower. By enabling this option, the loan documents will update the monthly payment amounts by taking the loan amount and subtracting the aggregate total of reserve amounts and will display this payment amount as the initial payment. The loan documents will also update the daily interest calculation for per diem interest. As the lender makes advances under the loan, the documents state that the monthly payments will increase over time. If you do not enable this option, interest will accrue on the entire loan amount (dutch interest), including all amounts held in reserve. The monthly payments will be calculated on the entire loan amount including any funds being reserved by lender. The monthly payments will remain the same during the loan term as interest is being charged on the entire loan amount.

enableLineOfCredit.title: Enable Line of Credit
enableLineOfCredit.description: A line of credit provides the borrower an ability to borrow up to a certain amount of funds based on certain conditions provided in the loan documents. The borrower is only charged interest on the funds the borrower receives under the loan. Enabling this feature allows the user to select on a loan-by-loan basis to utilize line of credit documentation rather than a closed end loan with a fixed amount advanced at closing.

enableMasterGuaranty.title: Enable Reference to Master Guaranty
enableMasterGuaranty.description: It is unlikely users will need to enable this permission. In rare instances, a lender may have required their loan guarantor to sign a Master Guaranty in which the guarantor signs one Master Guaranty and that guaranty binds the guarantor for all future loans with the lender. When enabled and used in a loan, this feature will insert references to the Master Guaranty. Enabling this feature allows the user to select on a loan-by-loan basis whether to include a reference in the loan documents to the Master Guaranty.

enableProFormaPolicy.title: Enable Attaching Pro Forma Exhibit Instead
enableProFormaPolicy.description: The standard loan interview asks users to identify a specific title commitment and identify specific exceptions to be deleted before the title policy is issued to the lender (i.e. Delete items 1-4, 5, 6), along with specific endorsements and form of coverage. Some lenders have already negotiated the final form of title policy with the title company in advance of loan closing, and the title company provides a Pro Forma to them which identifies the final form of title policy the lender will receive after loan closing. Enabling this feature allows the user to select on a loan-by-loan basis whether to attach the Pro Forma to the lenders instructions instead of identifying specific title exceptions that must be removed.

enableDeferredPayments.title: Enable Deferred Payments
enableDeferredPayments.description: This feature enables the user to select on a loan by loan basis whether the borrower's interest-only payments can be deferred for the term of the loan. This feature also allows the user to select whether the deferred payments should compound or capitalize.

enableCustomReturnAddress.title: Enable manually inputting Return Addresses
enableCustomReturnAddress.description: Enabling this permission will allow you to select whether you want to manually set Return Addresses for original and/or recorded documents, instead of these automatically being set to the same as the Notice Address.

enableExcludeLCI.title: Enable the Removal of Lender's Closing Instructions
enableExcludeLCI.description: By enabling this Permission, the user on a loan by loan basis will be able to remove the Lender's Closing Instructions from the document package which will also remove any questions in the loan interview which are only used to populate the LCI. **If this permission is enabled, and the User enables the feature inside the loan interview the User MUST provide their own lender's instructions to the closing agent.**

noticeTo.title: Borrower notice sent to
noticeTo.description: The loan documents identify the notice address for the borrower in various different documents in the set.  Most borrowers want mail sent and/or addressed to them, however, some borrowers may want notices sent to a third party, such as a custodian.  Regardless of whether mail is to be delivered to the Borrower, or a Third Party, you will need to enter the name and address to which the notices should be sent.

deliveryTo.title: Borrower delivery to
deliveryTo.usage: Person who will take delivery on Borrower's behalf ('Attn'). Only needed when borrowerInformation.noticeTo == 'Other'.
deliveryTo.description: If you are choosing mail to be delivered to a third party, enter the name of the third party here. You do not need to include c/o in front of the name as 'c/o' will automatically be inserted throughout the documents.

isAnyBorrowerIRA.title: Is any Borrower an IRA or 401k?

borrowers.title: Information for each Borrower
borrowers.description: This array contains one or more borrowers of the loan.

nonBorrowerOwners.title: Add Non-Borrower Property Owners // Non-Borrowers
nonBorrowerOwners.usage: The Non-Borrower Property Owners are parties who have an ownership interest in property to be pledged but who are not Borrowers on the loan. Use of this schema should be combined with enableFeatures.enableGrantors == true
nonBorrowerOwners.description: Selecting this option will prompt the user to enter owners of properties who are not going to also be the borrowers under the loan.  For example, if a trust owns the property but the individual trustees are the borrowers.  The Non-Borrower Property Owners are liable under the mortgage but not the payment obligations under the loan itself.

isGuaranty.title: Include a Guaranty?
isGuaranty.usage: This must be true to produce guaranties.

isMaximumGuarantorLiability.title: Will there be a maximum liability for any Guarantor?
isMaximumGuarantorLiability.usage: This must be true to add the max liability amount field to the individual guarantor dialog.

guarantors.title: Information for each Guarantor
guarantors.description: This array collects the information for one or more guarantors.

items.description: This object contains the attributes that make up a guarantor.

formationState.title: State of Formation
formationState.usage: The state of formation for certain kinds of entities. Only needed if entityType != 'individual' && entityType != 'trust'

isPowerOfAttorney.title: Is Guarantor using a Power of Attorney to Sign?

AttorneyInFact.title: Attorney-in-Fact
AttorneyInFact.usage: Only needed if entityType == 'individual' && isPowerOfAttorney == true

isTranslator.title: Does this Guarantor require a translator

maximumLiabilityAmount.title: Maximum Liability Under Guaranty
maximumLiabilityAmount.usage: Only needed if isMaximumGuarantorLiability == true and the user chooses to fill in

spousalSignature.title: If Guarantor is married, does Guarantor or Guarantors spouse reside in Alaska, Arizona, Idaho, Louisiana, Nevada, New Mexico, Texas, Washington, or Wisconsin?
spousalSignature.usage: Only needed if entityType == 'individual'. Note that some users choose to expand the list of states. The Default is 'true' if the guarantor is an individual.

complexSigners.title: Signers for Guarantor (complex)
complexSigners.usage: The signers for this Guarantor. Only needed if entityType != 'individual'
complexSigners.description: This array collects the signers for this Guarantor.

items.description: This object contains the attributes that make up a signer of a document. This object is used on multiple levels for the signers. This is the first level.

formationState.title: Organization state
formationState.usage: The state of formation for certain kinds of entities. Only needed if entityType != 'individual' && entityType != 'trust'

signers.title: Signers for Signers for Guarantor
signers.description: This array collects the signers for signers for this Guarantor.

items.description: This object contains the attributes that make up a signer of a document. This is the second level.

formationState.title: Organization state
formationState.usage: The state of formation for certain kinds of entities. Only needed if entityType != 'individual' && entityType != 'trust'

signers.title: Signers for Signers for Signers for Guarantor
signers.description: This array collects the signers for signers for signers for Guarantor.

items.description: This object contains the attributes that make up a signer of a document. This is the third level. At this level, the signer is an individual only.

owners.title: Owners for Signers for Signers for Guarantor

signers.title: Signers for Owners for Signers for Guarantor

complexOwners.title: Owners for Guarantor (complex)
complexOwners.usage: A more complex interface for sending owner information for an entity. Only relevant if enableFeatures.enableEntityOwnership == true. To use this, 'usesComplexSigners': true should also be sent as a property of each Guarantor. Should be used in combination with complexSigners.

signers.title: Signers for Signers for Owners for Guarantor

isGuarantorReporting.title: Include a Guarantor Financial Reporting Requirement?

isExhibitA.title: Lender's named in Exhibit A?
isExhibitA.usage: If this is true, no additional information is needed about the Lender(s) within this section EXCEPT for the properties that begin 'notice'.
isExhibitA.description: Use this if the Lender is not yet known. This will replace all references to Lender with a reference to an exhibit.

isMultipleLenders.title: Are there multiple lenders?
isMultipleLenders.usage: If this is true, the 'name' and 'cflNumber' properties below can be ignored. Instead, such information is entered into the same properties within the 'lenders' array. NOT needed if isExhibitA == true.

name.title: Enter Lender Name
name.usage: NOT needed if isExhibitA == true || isMultipleLenders == true.

entityType.title: Entity type
entityType.usage: NOT needed if isExhibitA == true || isMultipleLenders == true.

formationState.title: Organization state
formationState.usage: The state of formation for certain kinds of entities. Only needed if entityType != 'individual' && entityType != 'trust'. NOT needed if isExhibitA == true || isMultipleLenders == true.

isCFLNumber.title: Do any of the Lenders have a California CFL License?

cflNumber.title: Is the Lender a California lender with a CFL License number

noticeTo.title: Will notice be sent to the Lender or a Third Party on behalf of the Lender?

isCustomOriginalsReturnAddress.title: Deliver original signed loan documents (except the recorded documents) to a different address than the Notice address provided above?

isCustomRecordedReturnAddress.title: Deliver recorded documents to a different address than the Notice address provided above?

lenders.title: Enter lenders
lenders.usage: Not used if isExhibitA == true. Only needed if isMultipleLenders == true.
lenders.description: This array contains the attributes of a lender when there are more than one lender.

formationState.title: Organization state
formationState.usage: The state of formation for certain kinds of entities. Only needed if entityType != 'individual' && entityType != 'trust'

cflNumber.title: CFL License Number (if any)
cflNumber.usage: Optional, but only used if lenderInformation.isCFLNumber == true.

amount.title: Amount
amount.description: This is the amount of each Lender's contribution to the total loan amount. The sum of all Lenders' contributions becomes the loan amount when there are multiple lenders, in which case loan.amount is therefore ignored.

isRemoveACH.title: Remove the standard ACH from the document set? (This will remove the ACH itself, but all references to it will remain.)

isBroker.title: Is a Broker used on this transaction?

isRemoveTitleInsurance.title: Remove Title Insurance Policy?
isRemoveTitleInsurance.usage: Use of this property should be combined with enableFeatures.enableRemoveTitlePolicy == true
isRemoveTitleInsurance.description: Selecting 'Yes' will exclude instructions related to obtaining a lender's title insurance policy for the loan. Not recommended.

name.title: Title Company Name
name.usage: When isRemoveTitleInsurance == true, the title for this property will change to Closing Agent Company Name

contact.title: Title Officer Contact Name
contact.usage: When isRemoveTitleInsurance == true, the title for this property will change to Closing Agent Officer Contact Name

email.title: Title Officer Contact Email
email.usage: When isRemoveTitleInsurance == true, the title for this property will change to Closing Agent Officer Contact Email

address.title: Title Company Address
address.usage: Optional. When isRemoveTitleInsurance == true, the title for this property will change to Closing Agent Company Address

reportDate.title: Title Report Effective Date
reportDate.description: Include the date the preliminary title report is effective as of or was issued on. Please note that it may be different from the date the report was printed. Look for 'effective as' or 'issued on' before the date and use that date.

isSingleTitleReport.title: All Properties on Single Title Report?

isReduceCoverage.title: Reduce Title Insurance Coverage Amount from 125% to 100% of Loan Amount? (125% if 'No')
isReduceCoverage.description: We consider best practices to include instructing the title insurance company to insure the lender 125% of the loan amount. The reason for this is that in the case that there is a total insurable loss, such as fraud by the borrower, the amount of the lender's damages will typically exceed the loan amount as it will include loss interest, late fees, attorneys fees, etc. The default here will be to instruct the title insurance company to include 125% coverage, however, the user may select 'Yes' to this question to REDUCE coverage from 125% to 100% of the loan amount.

isProforma.title: Attach Proforma Policy Exhibit?
isProforma.description: The standard loan interview asks users to identify a specific title commitment and identify specific exceptions to be deleted before the title policy is issued to the lender (i.e. Delete items 1-4, 5, 6), along with specific endorsements and form of coverage. Some lenders have already negotiated the final form of title policy with the title company in advance of loan closing, and the title company provides a Pro Forma to them which identifies the final form of title policy the lender will receive after loan closing.  Using this feature will require the lender to attach the Pro Forma to the lender's instructions to the closing agent instead of identifying specific title exceptions that must be removed.

exceptionItems.title: Exception Items to be deleted by title
exceptionItems.description: Review the preliminary title report and list all exception items you will require to be deleted prior to having the title company issue your title policy, as follows: 1, 2 (showing as none due paid current), 6, 7, and 11. Use '(showing as none due, paid current)' when there are exception items dealing with taxes but they do not state whether they are paid current.

altaEndorsements.title: Additional ALTA Endorsements Requested by Lender
altaEndorsements.description: Include any endorsements to the title policy you would like included. The lender's instructions will automatically include the ALTA 9 (comprehensive), ALTA 14 (future advance), ALTA 22 (location), and ALTA 27 (usury), or comparable endorsement based on state entered.  Additionally, the loan documents will also automatically populate the following specific endorsements if the user selects certain interview answers: ALTA 6 (ARM Endorsement)- If the user selects a variable interest rate option; ALTA 10 (Assignment Endorsement) - If the user selects that that the loan will be sold at closing or a later time; ALTA 32-33 (Construction Draw Endorsement) - If the user selects that there is a Construction holdback in the loan. If you need others, list as follows: ALTA 8.1; ALTA 7; Form 9, TLTA 22 etc.

escrowInformation.title: Escrow Company Information
escrowInformation.description: This object contains the attributes that make up the contact information for the Escrow account.

preparerInformation.title: Preparer Information
preparerInformation.description: This object contains the attributes that make up the contact information for the Preparer.

closingContact.title: Closing Contact
closingContact.description: This object contains the attributes that make up the contact information for the Closing Contact.

isScheduleOfProperties.title: Use Schedule of Properties?
isScheduleOfProperties.usage: Use of this property should be combined with enableFeatures.enableScheduleOfProperties == true
isScheduleOfProperties.description: Selecting this will feature will change the documents and will now refer to the properties in an attached list.  This feature is most often used when there are numerous properties securing the loan and the user does not want to manually enter each and every property address.  When used, full property addresses do not need to be entered in the interview, but the state and county must still be entered for each property to determine how many mortgages must be produced.

isPartialRelease.title: Allow for partial release of collateral?

partialRelease.title: Can the Borrower release any Property securing the Loan without paying off the entire Loan?

legalDescription.title: Legal Description
legalDescription.usage: Use of this property should be combined with enableFeatures.enableLegalDescription == true
legalDescription.description: We do not recommend you use this functionality.  If you make an error in copying the legal description, or if the description contains inaccurate information, there is a possiblity that you will have problems enforcing a title claim. Instead, we recommend that you require the title company to insert the legal property description into the loan document set, as they are the party who is insuring the accuracy of the legal description, and will thus become liable for resolving any issues that may arise due to inaccuracy.

legalDescriptionAbbreviated.title: Abbreviated Legal Description for Washington Deed of Trust
legalDescriptionAbbreviated.description: We recommend using this function if there is only one property located in Washington. If there are multiple properties located in Washington, the description entered for the first property located in Washington will be the **ONLY** one that will appear in all security instruments related to Washington properties.

governingLawState.title: Governing Law State
governingLawState.description: Lenders may choose to govern specific loan documents (ex. the Note, Loan Agreement, Personal Guaranty, etc.) under the laws of their own state; however, most lenders will choose to use the state the collateral property is located in to govern the remainder of the loan. The Security Instrument (Mortgage/Deed of Trust) will always be governed under the laws of the property state. Lenders may choose to govern the transaction under their own state laws for a variety of reasons, but primarily will choose this option when their state's usury laws permit the lender to charge a higher interest rate than that of the collateral property state. For example: a Washington based lender may want to use Washington's state law, which has no usury limitations for business purpose loans, versus Rhode Island's, which has a maximum usury percentage of 21%. For best practice, there should be a nexus between the governing law state and the underlying parties involved in the transaction. For example, if the lender is located in Florida, it could be appropriate to use Florida as the governing law state. However, it would generally be inappropriate to use Florida as the governing law state if the borrower, lender, and property were all based in another state.

noteCounty.title: Note County (County for Arbitration)
noteCounty.description: Most lenders will choose to use the state and county in which the collateral property is located, to determine where disputes should be resolved. For example, if a property is located in Orange County, California most lenders will choose to resolve all disputes between themselves and the borrower in the Orange County courts.  If the lender chooses to govern the transaction under a different state law (rather than that of the collateral property state), they typically will select the state and county in which they, themselves, are located in.

isConfessionOfJudgment.title: Remove Confession of Judgment Provisions?
isConfessionOfJudgment.description: The default loan documents will automatically include Confession of Judgment Provisions if the Property State and the Governing Law State match and are any of: Delaware, Illinois, Maryland, Ohio, Pennsylvania, or Virginia.  By selecting this feature you will remove the Confession of Judgment Provisions in the loan documents even if the Property State and Governing Law state match and are in the states identified above.

isFixtureFiling.title: Include Fixture Filing with each Security Instrument?
isFixtureFiling.description: The security instruments automatically include fixture filing language.  All state except for Louisiana permit the Deed of Trust or Mortgage to include fixture filing language without the need to separately record a fixture filing.  In Louisiana the system will automatically generate a UCC to be recorded along with the mortgage. This option should only be used when you want to separately produce a UCC to be recorded along with the Mortgage or Deed of Trust which simply re-states the Fixture filing section of the security instrument in the UCC filing. It is generally not recommended to take this approach.

isMultiUnitCollateral.title: Does the real property collateral include 5+ units?
isMultiUnitCollateral.description: Answering 'Yes' will add the 'Pre-Closing Lease Occupancy Agreement' provision that requires Borrower to lease the Collateral Real Property to at least 90% occupancy and provide proof of such within 6 months of the date of the Loan Agreement.

customNotaryAcknowledgmentState.title: Select which state's notary acknowledgments to produce.

collateralProperties.title: Properties
collateralProperties.description: This array collects the properties for this transaction.

items.description: This object contains the attributes that make up a property in a transaction.

propertyID.title: Property Tax ID Number (APN)
propertyID.usage: The Property Tax ID Number for the collateral property (also called the 'APN'). This is REQUIRED for each property submitted, even if the user intends to send partial data and complete the remainder of the form by hand.
propertyID.description: Enter the tax identification number(s) for this property. This can sometimes be referred to as the Assessor's Parcel Number (APN), Tax Parcel Number, Property ID Number, or something similar. This number is typically found on the title committment issued by the title company being used on the transaction.

lienPosition.title: Lien Position
lienPosition.usage: This property is converted to a string within the interview, but the API requires it to be sent as an integer, then converts it to a string.

propertyType.title: Property Type
propertyType.usage: Only needed if the collateral property is in the state of Maryland, New York, Oregon, Pennsylvania, or Kentucky. (Some users have client-specific provisions that require it regardless of property state.) The 'Residential' option selects '1-6 Single Family Resident' in New York, and '1-4 Single Family Residence' in every other state. The 'Multi-Family' option selects '7+ Multi-Family Property' in New York, and '5+ Multi-Family Property' in every other state.

rentalProperty.title: Is this a residential rental property?
rentalProperty.usage: Only needed if state == 'Utah' While this property looks like it should be a boolean, it is set up as a string to prevent the system from automatically concluding that the collateral property IS NOT a rental property when no answer is provided. That would cause incorrect information to be entered into the security instrument.

isLeaseholdMortgage.title: Is Borrower leasing the Property instead of a Fee Ownership?
isLeaseholdMortgage.description: Select 'Yes' if this property is leased by the borrower rather than owned, meaning the mortgage will be a 'Leasehold Mortgage' - that is, the mortgage secures the borrower's rights under their lease and not the ownership of the property itself.  This is more often used in commercial real estate, or for residential property in certain limited geographic locations where leaseholds are more common.  This selection will add additional language to the loan documents and produce a recommendation for two additional documents: a Ground Lease Estoppel Certificate and a Leasehold Mortgage Agreement.

leaseholdLessor.title: List Parties Defined as Ground Lessor
leaseholdLessor.usage: Finishes the definition ''Ground Lessor' means ____________, its successors and/or assigns.'

isHomestead.title: Is the Property the Borrower's primary residence?

usesScheduleOfProperties.title: Uses Schedule of Properties
usesScheduleOfProperties.usage: This property is ignored by the interpreter. It can optionally be sent as 'true' to prompt validation functions using the final validation schema to check that the correct information was sent for each collateral property. (Less information is needed for each repetition of 'collateralProperties' when usesScheduleOfProperties == true)

releasePrice.title: Minimum Release Price
releasePrice.usage: Only needed if collateral.isPartialRelease == true && collateral.partialRelease == 'Release Price'

releasePriceBuildingLoan.title: Minimum Release Price
releasePriceBuildingLoan.usage: This is only used with the NYBuildingLoan app. Only needed if collateral.isPartialRelease == true && collateral.partialRelease == 'Release Price'

isPurchaseMoney.title: Is this a purchase money loan?
isPurchaseMoney.description: Indicate whether the loan funds are being used toward purchasing the property. If yes, 'Purchase Money' will be added to title of the security instrument and as appropriate elsewhere, and if the Property is located in Delaware a new section will be added to security instrument reflecting all or part of the purchase price of the Property is paid for with the money loaned.

trustee.title: Choose Trustee of the Deed of Trust
trustee.description: PLEASE READ THIS DESCRIPTION: FOR MOST USERS THIS PROPERTY SHOULD BE LEFT EMPTY. The options for this dropdown on the Lightning Docs 'Property Information' form can vary depending on the property state and other factors, so no 'enum' options are given here. If you know the exact option you would wish to select you can send it to this key. If you wish to assign a trustee that does not appear on that list, you can send 'Other' to this key, and then specify the name (and address, if needed) using the keys below. However, when left empty, Lightning Docs has logic to default this value in the background to the best possible option for most LD users. Therefore, unless you require the use of a particular, unlisted trustee, it is usually best to ignore this property. Only used when the collateral property is in one of the following states: Arizona, Alaska, California, Colorado, District of Columbia, Idaho, Maryland, Mississippi, Missouri, Montana, Nebraska, North Carolina, Nevada, Oregon, Tennessee, Texas, Utah, Virginia, Washington and West Virginia.

trusteeName.title: Trustee Name
trusteeName.usage: Only needed when 'Other' was selected for trustee.

trusteeAddress.title: Trustee Address
trusteeAddress.usage: Trustee's Street, City, State, and Zip. Only needed when 'Other' was selected for trustee and the collateral property is in one of the following states: Arizona, Mississippi, Tennessee, Texas, Virginia, and West Virginia.

trusteeCounty.title: Trustee County
trusteeCounty.usage: Only needed when the collateral property is in Tennessee.

isTenancyInCommonAgreement.title: Are the properties owned under a Tenancy in Common Agreement?
isTenancyInCommonAgreement.usage: Only used when enableTenancyInCommonAgreement == true && there is more than one property owner.
isTenancyInCommonAgreement.description: This feature will add language to the Security Instrument that subordinates the rights and remedies found in the owners (co-tenant's) Tenant In Common Agreement to the rights of the Lender under the Loan Documents, and provides for additional promises of each co-tenant for the benefit of Lender.

tenancyInCommonAgreementDate.title: Effective Date of Tenancy In Common Agreement

owners.title: Owners
owners.description: This array collects the owners of this property.

items.description: This object contains the attributes that make up an owner of this property.

owner.title: Owner Name
owner.usage: The owner's name exactly as it appears in the borrowers (or nonBorrowerOwners) array. No two borrowers should have the same name.

vesting.title: Vested As
vesting.usage: How the owner is vested, eg, 'a single man' or 'a married woman as her sole and separate property'. See lightningdocs for other examples, but the text can be anything; it need not be among the options given in lightningdocs. IMPORTANT: answer 'married' (without the quotes) for the FIRST of two married individuals vested together, then give the actual vesting for the second of the two. This will combine them together for vesting.

seniorLiens.title: Request for Notice of Default of Senior Liens
seniorLiens.description: This array collects the senior liens for this property.
seniorLiens.usage: Information about senior liens used in the security instrument's Request for Notice of Default of Senior Lien. Only needed if lienPosition > 1 && (state == 'California' || state == 'Nebraska')

items.description: This object contains the attributes that make up a senior lien for a property.

loan.title: Standard Loan Terms
loan.description: This object contains properties that make up the terms of a loan.

loanNumber.title: Loan Number
loanNumber.description: Alphanumeric loan number assigned to the loan.

closingDate.title: Closing Date
closingDate.description: The earliest date the loan documents will be signed. The loan documents are drafted so that the loan closing date (when loan funds are disbursed to or on behalf of the borrower) can occur anytime within the month, regardless of the actual closing date that is selected.

term.title: Loan Term
term.description: The term of the loan in months.

amount.title: Loan Amount
amount.description: The amount of the loan is the sum of all Lenders' contributions, when there are multiple lenders.

amortization.title: Amortization Period (in months)
amortization.usage: Should be 0 (zero) when isInterestOnly == true && ( ioPeriod == term ).
amortization.description: The Amortization Period for a fully amortizing loan is the number of months it takes a Borrower to pay off a loan in full by making payments of principal and interest. If a fully-amortizing loan does NOT have an interest-only feature, the Amortization Period is equal to the Loan Term. If a fully amortizing loan DOES have an interest-only feature, the Amortization Period is equal to the Loan Term minus the Interest-Only Period. The Amortization Period for an interest-only loan with no monthly payments of principal is 0. (No value for this property is needed for an interest-only loan). Some loans do not fully amortize. For example, a Borrower with a 15-year (180-month) loan may want to make smaller monthly payments based on a 30-year (360-month) Amortization Period.  In this example, the Borrower will pay a balloon payment at the end of the 180-month loan term.

rate.title: Interest Rate %
rate.description: The annual interest rate on the loan as a percentage.

defaultRate.title: Default interest rate
defaultRate.description: The annual interest rate when the borrower defaults on the loan.

calculation.title: Interest Calculation Type
calculation.description: Normally monthly payments are established by creating a fictitious year of 360 days with even 30-day months. The payments are always the same each month even though there are a different number of actual days in each month. This is considered the standard method to calculate monthly payments. DSCR loans should always use 30/360. Some bridge lenders prefer to charge a daily interest rate and they can do so in one of two ways: 360/Actual: Instead of dividing the year into 30-day months, this method takes the yearly payment divided by 360 days and charges the daily amount each day so that the payments in a 30-day month are different than a 31-day month. Doing so will charge the borrower 5 extra days of interest each year. OR 365/Actual: In this method, the annual payment is divided by 365 days and similar to 360/Actual, the monthly payments will change based on how many calendar days are in each month. The actual amount paid over the year is the same as 30/360.

isInterestOnly.title: Is there an interest-only period?
isInterestOnly.description: In an interest-only loan, borrowers are only making monthly payments that cover the interest accruing under the loan. In a fully or partially amortized loan the borrower will make monthly payments towards both the principal and interest accruing under the loan. Some loans will include a combination of interest-only and amortized payments.

ioPeriod.title: Interest-Only Period (in months)
ioPeriod.description: Enter the number of months that the borrower will make interest-only payments. Example 1: If you are using the system to create a 12 month 'fix and flip' loan, in which all payments will be interest only, you would enter '12' here. Example 2: If you are using the system to create a 360 month DSCR loan, which is interest-only for the first 10 years, you would enter '120' here for 120 months.

isVariable.title: Variable Rate?
isVariable.usage: Should not be used with isInterestStep.
isVariable.description: Is this a variable rate loan (Adjustable Rate Mortgage)?

variableInformation.title: Variable Rate Information
variableInformation.description: This object contains properties that make up the terms of the variable rate information for the loan.

variableMargin.title: Margin Percent
variableMargin.description: The margin is added to the index selected to create the actual interest rate during any change date. For example, if you enter a Prime Index as the index rate and state that the Margin is 2% that means you would add 2% to the Prime Index on the change date to determine the interest rate.

isDailyRate.title: Use a Daily Floating Rate?
isDailyRate.description: Normally adjustable rate loans have an initial change date (for example 5 years) followed by subsequent change dates (annually thereafter). Selecting 'Yes' to this option will write language into the Note permitting a daily floating rate in which the loan servicer will need to calculate the interest rate daily to determine the amount of interest which accrues on that day to determine the final monthly payment. If the user selects this option, you can enter '0' in 'Number of Months before First Payment Change Date' if the user would like the loan to be on a daily floating rate from loan origination. Otherwise, enter a number of months that will need to occur before the Daily Floating Rate occurs.

variableFirstChange.title: Number of Months before First Payment Change Date
variableFirstChange.description: Enter the number of months from the closing until the month when the amount of the loan payment can change for the first time. For a 10-1 ARM, the number is 120 (12 x 10). For a 7-1 ARM, the number is 84 (12 x 7). For a 5-1 ARM the number is 60 (12 x 5). For a 3-1 ARM the number of 36 (12 x 3).

variableFirstCap.title: First Interest Cap Percent
variableFirstCap.usage: Optional. Only used if isDailyRate == false.
variableFirstCap.description: The maximum amount, expressed as a percentage, that the initial interest rate can increase on the first interest rate change date. For example, assume that a 5-1 ARM has an initial interest rate of 7.0% and a first interest cap percent of 2.0%. In this example, the interest rate on the first interest rate change date (60th month) will never be higher than 9.0% (7.0% + 2.0%).

variableSubsequentChange.title: Number of Months between Change Dates after First Payment Change Date
variableSubsequentChange.description: Enter the number of months between each interest rate change date that occurs after the first interest rate change date. For a 5-1 ARM, there are 12 months between each interest rate change date following the first interest rate change date (60th month).

variableSubsequentCap.title: Subsequent Interest Cap Percentage
variableSubsequentCap.usage: Optional. Only used if isDailyRate == false.
variableSubsequentCap.description: The maximum amount, expressed as a percentage, that the interest rate can increase between each interest rate change date following the first interest rate change date. For example, assume that a 5-1 ARM has an initial interest rate of 7.0%, a first interest cap percent of 2.0% and a subsequent interest rate cap of 2.0%. In this example, the interest rate on the first interest rate change date (60th month) will never be higher than 9.0% (7.0% + 2.0%), the interest rate on the next interest rate change date (61st month) will never be higher than 11.0% (9.0% + 2.0%), and the interest rate on the next interest rate change date will never be higher than 13% (11.0% + 2.0%).

variableFloor.title: Floor Rate Percent
variableFloor.description: The interest rate for a loan can never be less than the floor rate percentage at any time. For example, assume that a floor rate percent for a loan is 7.0%. This means that the interest rate for the loan will never be less than 7.0% The floor rate is usually the initial interest rate.

variableCeiling.title: Maximum Interest Percent Over Floor Rate
variableCeiling.description: This is the maximum amount that the interest rate can increase over the life of the loan. For example, assume that a loan has an initial interest rate of 7.0% and a 'Lifetime Maximum Interest Rate % Increase' of 5.0%. The interest rate for this loan can never be higher than 12% (7.0% + 5%).

index.title: Variable Interest Rate Index
index.description: Select the interest rate 'Index' from the drop-down menu.  The 'Index' is added to a 'Margin' to calculate the interest rate for a loan.  For example, assume that the interest rate 'Index' (e.g., Wall Street Journal Prime) is 7.5% and that the 'Margin' is 2.0 %. In this example, the interest rate is 9.5% (7.5% + 2.0%).

isInterestStep.title: Interest Rate Step
isInterestStep.usage: Should not be used with isVariable.
isInterestStep.description: Most loans have a fixed interest rate during the full term of the loan. If you would like to increase the interest rate after a set time period: select 'Yes' to this feature, then enter the interest rate and the duration (in months) for which interest will accrue at said rate.

stepInformation.title: Interest Rate Steps
stepInformation.description: This array collects the interest rate and the duration in months for which interest will accrue at said rate.

isNonDutchAll.title: Does interest accrue on all reserve funds only when they are advanced to the borrower? (non-dutch interest)
isNonDutchAll.usage: If this is answered true, loan.features.construction.isNonDutch does not need to also be answered true.

isMERS.title: MERS Loan?
isMERS.description: MERS refers to Mortgage Electronic Registration Systems, Inc., a company which acts as a nominee for the lender.  MERS requires their address and a variety of other changes to the loan documents to comply with MERS requirements. Selecting this option will apply those changes automatically. The lender simply must enter their MERS numbers and will not need to make other changes to make the loan documents MERS compliant. The  lender must still submit the final documents to MERS after loan closing.

firstPaymentDate.title: First Payment Date
firstPaymentDate.usage: Optional. Used to override the automatic calculation of the First Payment Date.
firstPaymentDate.description: If a date is selected other than the first day of the second month following closing, the Lender's Closing Instructions will instruct escrow or title to discuss with your closing contact how per diem interest is to be handled. For example:  Ordinarily, if the loan closes on January 10, 2020 the first payment date would be March 1, 2020, and per diem interest would be collected from January 10 to January 31.

maturityDate.title: Maturity Date
maturityDate.usage: Optional. Used to override the automatic calculation of the Maturity Date.

isCEMAOrEMA.title: Is a CEMA required?
isCEMAOrEMA.usage: Can only be used if the collateral property is in New York, and New York law governs the Note

isBorrowerPurchasingRealPropertyCollater.title: Is borrower purchasing the real property collateral?

lender1LoanAmountCEMAOrEMA.title: Lender 1 Loan Amount
lender1LoanAmountCEMAOrEMA.description: Existing First Lien Unpaid Principal Balance

lender2LoanAmountCEMAOrEMA.title: Lender 2 Loan Amount
lender2LoanAmountCEMAOrEMA.usage: Optional. Only used if isCEMAOrEMA == true
lender2LoanAmountCEMAOrEMA.description: Existing Second Lien Unpaid Principal Balance (if applicable)

additionalAmountAdvancedCEMA.title: Additional Amount Advanced, if any ('New Money' only)
additionalAmountAdvancedCEMA.usage: Optional. Only used if isCEMAOrEMA == true

features.description: This object contains the attributes that make up the feature set for a loan transaction.

isCreditLine.title: Is this a line of credit?
isCreditLine.description: The Line of Credit feature allows you to make periodic advances of loan proceeds to the borrower.  If you select 'revolving' this will enable the borrower to repay advances that are made and then re-borrow them later. Depending on which state the property securing the loan is in, you will be able to choose among the following three variants:  Standard, Mandatory, and Optional.  'Optional' provides the most flexibility to the lender in determining when or if to make an advance to the borrower.  All advances are made at lender's discretion. 'Standard' provides a hybrid approach, giving the lender flexibility in using discretion in approving certain conditions the borrower must meet in order to receive an advance.  Once the conditions are approved, however, the advance must be made in most circumstances.  'Mandatory' provides that as long as the conditions for advances are met, with little to no discretion from the lender, the advance must be made in most circumstances. Some states make a distinction between advances made at lender's discretion and those without -- affecting the priority of the lien as to each advance.  In these states, the Mandatory variant is recommended.  The states which make this distinction are: Idaho, Illinois, Massachusetts, Minnesota, Nebraska, New Jersey, Ohio, Oklahoma, Oregon, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, Tennessee, Utah, Vermont, West Virginia, Wisconsin, Wyoming, and the District of Columbia.

creditLineInformation.title: Line of Credit Questions
creditLineInformation.description: This object contains the attributes that make up credit line information.

isRevolving.title: Can the borrower pay down principal and reborrow funds (i.e. revolving)?

maxDraws.title: Maximum Number of Draws per Month

isDeferredPayments.title: Defer Payments to Maturity?
isDeferredPayments.usage: Use of this property should be combined with enableFeatures.enableDeferredPayments == true
