isCompoundingInterest.title: Add Deferred Payments to Principal (Negative Amortization / Compounding Interest)?

prepaymentPremium.title: Select Prepayment Premium
prepaymentPremium.usage: Used if isPrepaymentPremium == true; Answers 'Yield Maintenance', '90-Day Step', and 'Minimum Interest' are only available to some users.

prepaymentLockoutAmount.title: Penalty Dollar Amount
prepaymentLockoutAmount.usage: Only needed if prepaymentPremium == 'Lockout' && prepaymentLockoutCalculation == 'Dollar Amount'

isPrepaymentLockoutInterest.title: Borrower has to pay interest through penalty period in addition to penalty?

prepaymentTerm3.title: Number of Years
prepaymentTerm3.usage: Only needed if prepaymentPremium == 'Non Linear Step'.

prepaymentSteps.title: Penalty Percentage (%)
prepaymentSteps.usage: Only needed if prepaymentPremium == 'Non Linear Step'.

lastStepYearLength.title: Length of last year (in months)
lastStepYearLength.usage: CLIENT SPECIFIC. Used if prepaymentPremium == 'Non Linear Step'.

isPrepaymentMinimumPayment.title: Can borrower pay 20% in a year without triggering prepayment penalty?
isPrepaymentMinimumPayment.usage: Only needed if prepaymentPremium is 'Guaranteed Interest', 'Linear Step', 'Lockout', or 'Non Linear Step'.

isBridgeToPerm.title: Bridge to Perm Loan?
isBridgeToPerm.usage: Must be used in combination with loan.isInterestOnly == true.
isBridgeToPerm.description: Normally a borrower would first take out a Bridge/Fix and Flip/Construction loan, then stabilize the property and complete any construction.  Once the property is stabilized, typically with a tenant in place, that same borrower typically seeks long term lower cost financing usually through the form of a DSCR loan.  This feature combines both loan features into a single loan. An initial bridge loan which is interest-only, and typically contains a construction period, which then automatically converts to a 30 year perm loan.

isConstruction.title: Is Lender reserving funds for construction or rehab?
isConstruction.description: Will any loan funds be held by lender, or its agent, to be used to pay for construction? If so, indicate 'yes'.

isBuildingLoanIntended.title: Is a NY Building Loan Intended?
isBuildingLoanIntended.usage: This property should be sent when the 'MasterLoan' app is intended to be paired with the 'NYBuildingLoan' app. NYBuildingLoan should only be used when all collateral properties are in New York, among other requirements.
isBuildingLoanIntended.description: Both the Building Loan and Master Loan applications use the exact same interview unless the answers are exported from one application and imported in the other one. If a new answer file is not created for transactions where there is an associated non-building loan, changing the interview in one application will change the answer for the other.  If the building and non-building loans will have different terms, including interest rates or maturity dates, a duplicate interview should be created to ensure the proper terms populate for each document set.  NOTE THAT THE LOAN AMOUNT ENTERED IN THE MASTER LOAN APPLICATION SHOULD NOT INCLUDE THE BUILDING LOAN AMOUNT AS THAT AMOUNT IS ENTERED IN THE BUILDING LOAN APPLICATION.

construction.title: Construction
construction.description: This object contains the attributes that make up a construction transaction.

constructionType.title: Type of Construction Reserve Language to be used

reserveAmount.title: Amount withheld from Loan Proceeds
reserveAmount.usage: Needed for all construction reserves. This property also serves as the loan amount for the NYBuildingLoan app.

isNonDutch.title: Does interest accrue on reserved construction funds only when they are advanced to the borrower? (non-dutch interest)
isNonDutch.description: For construction loans, lender can choose to charge interest only on the amounts advanced to the borrower, commonly referred to as non-dutch interest, or the lender can choose to charge interest on the entire loan amount, commonly referred to as dutch interest. Answer yes to this question if the lender is only charging interest on amounts advanced to the borrower. By selecting 'Yes' the loan documents will update the monthly payment amounts by taking the loan amount and subtracting the construction reserve amount and will display this payment amount as the initial payment. The loan documents will also update the daily interest calculation for per diem interest. As the lender makes construction advances under the loan the documents state that the monthly payments will increase over time. If the user answers No to this question and is charging interest on the entire loan amount (dutch interest) then the monthly payments will be calculated on the entire loan amount including any construction funds being reserved by lender. The monthly payments will remain the same during the loan term as interest is being charged on the entire loan amount.

isExcludeSchedule.title: Exclude Disbursement Schedule
isExcludeSchedule.description: The standard loan documents include numerous references to a Disbursement Schedule between the Lender and Borrower. This Disbursement Schedule is intended to be attached to the Loan Agreement as an Exhibit by the user. It is recommended that the Lender and Borrower come up with a Disbursement Schedule outlining the workitems, budgets, and timelines associated with the construction project. However, if the user does not want to include any references to a Disbursement Schedule in the Loan Agreement and does not intend on including one as an attachment to the Loan Agreement, the user may select 'Yes' to this question to EXCLUDE the Disbursement Schedule. Please note that loans which are arranged by a California Real Estate Broker and secured by property in California should always include a Disbursement Schedule.

isRetainage.title: Retainage Required
isRetainage.description: Inserts language which allows lender to holdback a percentage of each disbursement (defaulted to 10%) to ensure that all construction costs are paid.  The retained amounts would be disbursed as part of the final disbursement once all conditions have been met.

isFundsControlAgent.title: Will Lender use a third-party Funds Control Agent?

isAssignmentOfPermits.title: Include a Separate Recordable Assignment of Permits and Agreements?
isAssignmentOfPermits.description: Allows the lender to take a collateral assignment of all permits and construction agreements and creates a recordable document that is separate from the Security Instrument.

assignmentOfPermitsProperties.title: Select the properties for Assignments of Permits
assignmentOfPermitsProperties.usage: Only needed if isAssignmentOfPermits == true. Give the Property ID (APN) of each collateral property for which you want an Assignment of Permits.
assignmentOfPermitsProperties.description: This array collects the properties for which an Assignment of Permits is needed.

isConstructionContract.title: Is there a Construction Contract?
isConstructionContract.description: Allows the lender to take a collateral assignment of any construction contract(s). This can facilitate taking over construction in the event of default.

constructionContract.title: Construction Contract Information
constructionContract.description: This object contains the attributes that make up a construction contract.

designContract.title: Design Contract Information
designContract.description: This object contains the attributes that make up Design Contract information.

isConstructionCompletionGuaranty.title: Include Third Party Construction Completion Guaranty?
isConstructionCompletionGuaranty.description: If the loan includes a construction holdback and the user includes a guaranty as part of the interview, construction completion requirements automatically populate in the personal guaranty for that guarantor.  This option is only to be used when a THIRD PARTY to the transaction (i.e. someone other than any guarantors) are also obligated to complete construction at the property.  If selected, an additional stand-alone guaranty of completion will be produced for that third party.

constructionCompletionGuarantors.title: Give the Guarantor Name for each Construction Completion Guaranty
constructionCompletionGuarantors.description: This array collects the Guarantor Name for each construction completion guaranty.

isBorrowerContribution.title: Does the Borrower contribute to the Reserve?

borrowerContributionDollars.usage: Only used if isBorrowerContribution == true. Mutually exclusive with borrowerContributionPercent

borrowerContributionPercent.usage: Only used if isBorrowerContribution == true. Mutually exclusive with borrowerContributionDollars

extension.title: Extension Information
extension.description: This object contains the attributes that make up Extension Information.

monthsPerExtension.title: Number of Months for Each Extension

feeAmount.title: Percent of Loan Balance for Extension Fee/Amount of Extension Fee

isAutoExtension.title: Include Automatic Extension language in loan documents?
isAutoExtension.usage: CLIENT SPECIFIC. Only used if isExtension == false. Use of this property should be combined with enableFeatures.enableAutoExtension == true
isAutoExtension.description: Select 'Yes' to include an automatic extension of the maturity date.  There can only be one (1) automatic extension, but the length of the extension, the fee charged (if any), and the increase in the interest rate (if any) may be determined by the user.  When used in connection with a variable interest rate, new intereset rate specified (if any) will replace the MARGIN percentage.  When used in connection with a Step-Up interest rate, the new interest rate (if any) will replace the then-current rate.

autoExtension.title: Automatic Extension Information
autoExtension.description: This object contains the attributes that make up Automatic Extension Information.

feeAmount.title: Percent of Loan Balance/Amount of Extension Fee

interestRate.title: Enter the new Interest Rate (or Margin if variable rate) %
interestRate.description: IF FIXED or STEP-UP INTEREST:  Enter the **NEW Total Interest** percentagage only.  This will replace the existing interest rate during the extension period.  IF VARIABLE INTEREST:  Enter the **NEW Margin** percentage only.  This will replace the existing Margin percentage during the extension period.

isExitFee.title: Exit Fee?
isExitFee.description: Selecting 'Yes' will require borrower to pay a fee upon the earlier of (i) the Maturity Date; (ii) Borrower's prepayment of the loan in full prior to Maturity; (iii) a transfer of Borrower interest in the real property; or (iv) an Event of Default.  Exit Fees are often used when a Borrower cannot pay some or all of the origination fee at loan closing and instead is assessed a fee at loan payoff.

isTerminationFee.title: Termination Fee?
isTerminationFee.description: Selecting 'Yes' will require borrower to pay a fee upon the earlier of (i) the Maturity Date; (ii) Borrower's prepayment of the loan in full prior to Maturity; (iii) a transfer of Borrower interest in the real property; or (iv) an Event of Default.

deferredBrokerFee.title: Deferred Broker Fees?
deferredBrokerFee.usage: Optional; sending no answer is functionally equivalent to answering 'None'.
deferredBrokerFee.description: Selecting 'Yes' creates language that specifies the fee owed to the identified broker will be deferred to the earlier of the maturity date, the release of the property, or an event of default instead of being paid through the loan proceeds at time of loan origination.

deferredBrokerFeeAmount.title: Amount/Percentage of Loan Amount
deferredBrokerFeeAmount.usage: Only used if deferredBrokerFee == 'Dollar Amount' || deferredBrokerFee == 'Percentage of Loan'.

deferredOriginationFee.title: Are you deferring any origination fees??
deferredOriginationFee.usage: Optional; sending no answer is functionally equivalent to answering 'None'.
deferredOriginationFee.description: Selecting 'Yes' creates language that specifies the origination fee owed to lender will be deferred to the earlier of the maturity date, the release of the property, or an event of default instead of being paid through the loan proceeds at time of loan origination.

deferredOriginationFeeAmount.title: Amount/Percentage of Loan Amount
deferredOriginationFeeAmount.usage: Only used if deferredOriginationFee == 'Dollar Amount' || deferredOriginationFee == 'Percentage of Loan'.

deferredOriginationMonths.title: Months before Deferred Fee Starts
deferredOriginationMonths.usage: CLIENT SPECIFIC. Only used if deferredOriginationFee == 'Percentage of Loan'.

isBorrowerServicingFees.title: Is Borrower Responsible for all Servicing Fees?
isBorrowerServicingFees.description: Select 'Yes' to add language within the loan documents that specifies the borrower is to be responsible for paying all servicing costs.

isDSCR.title: Include a Debt Service Coverage Ratio Requirement and Event of Default?
isDSCR.description: For rental properties or other cash flowing real estate, certain mortgage lenders require the borrower to maintain a minimum Debt Service Coverage Ratio for the life of the loan and the failure to maintain this ratio is an Event of Default under the Loan Documents. If you Select Yes, please state the ratio that the borrower must exceed (e.g 1.15). For example a DSCR Ratio of 1.10 would mean that if you divided the net operating income of the property by the debt service (principal/interest payments) for that time period, the number must exceed 1.10 or the borrower would be in default under the loan documents.

isDSCREstimate.title: Use Freddy Mac Covenant/Lender's Estimate?
isDSCREstimate.usage: CLIENT SPECIFIC. Only used if isDSCR == true.

isCannabisLoan.title: Cannabis Loan?
isCannabisLoan.description: Select 'Yes' to add language to the loan agreement which requires borrower to promise not to operate and/or allow its tenants to operate a cannabis related business at the property until it and/or any tenants have all applicable licenses or permits necessary to operate the cannabis related business at the property. The loan agreement will also permit the borrower and/or its tenants to operate a cannabis related business at the property so long as it is only in violation of federal law and not state law. This also creates a new event of default for failure to maintain these licenses or permits.

cannabisAssignmentOfPermitsProperties.title: Select the properties for Assignments of Permits
cannabisAssignmentOfPermitsProperties.usage: Only needed if isCannabisLoan == true. Give the Property ID (APN) of each collateral property for which you want an Assignment of Permits.
cannabisAssignmentOfPermitsProperties.description: This array collects the properties under the Cannabis loan for which you want an Assignment of Permits.

isSBA.title: SBA Loan?
isSBA.description: This option is used when the loan is made through or in conjunction with the U.S. Small Business Administration.  Additional language and documents are added.  You should not use this option without discussing with the Lightning Docs team.

isSPE.title: Require Borrower to be a Special Purpose Entity?
isSPE.description: Using this option requires the borrower to be a Special Purpose Entity and will include certain provisions to the loan documents limiting the borrower's ability to take certain actions such as guaranty other obligations or take on new loans.  When required in the loan documents, this option adds additional events of default if borrower were to make any changes to the entity structure, or enter into certain other contracts.  If the user further selects a 'Permit Borrower to use Recycled SPE' then additional language is added as borrower representations about the existence and financial and legal status of the entity.

isAffiliateLoan.title: Affiliate Loan
isAffiliateLoan.description: This option is reserved for when the lender and borrower are affiliates of one another.  Selecting this feature will remove instructions to obtain a title policy and all other loan documents (including personal guaranties) other than the Loan Agreement, Note, and Mortgage.

isLockbox.title: Rental Income Lockbox?
isLockbox.description: Selecting 'Yes' will create a requirement for a Rental Income Lockbox account in which the rent received by the borrower as the landlord of the property are deposited into an account mutually controlled by the borrower and the lender. This will require additional documentation and coordination with the chosen bank.  There are 3 further options:  Hard Lockbox, Soft Lockbox, and Springing Lockbox.  **Hard Lockbox** means it must be set up immediately after closing and rent will be deposited beginning on the date chosen.  **Soft Lockbox** means it must be set up immediately after closing, but rent will not be deposited until an event of default.  **Springing Lockbox** means both the setup and the rent collection will not occur until an event of default.

lockboxDate.title: First Rent Sweep Date for Hard Lockbox
lockboxDate.usage: Only needed if isLockbox == true && lockboxType == 'Hard'.

isImpounds.title: Are there any tax and/or insurance impounds?

interestReserve.title: Debt Service Reserve (Interest Reserve)?
interestReserve.usage: Optional; sending no answer is functionally equivalent to answering 'None'.
interestReserve.description: Some lenders prefer to holdback either a few months of interest or a specific dollar amount of interest to be used to pay the monthly interest only payments. This is most commonly used when the property has no cash flow such as with a construction loan. Instead of the borrower making monthly payments to the lender, the Debt Service Reserve will be used to make monthly payments until the funds are depleted.

interestReserveMonths.title: Months of Reserve
interestReserveMonths.description: By entering a number of months here, the system will automatically calculate the monthly payment amount and multiply by the number of months the user enters.  A computation will not be performed if the user selects anything other than 30/360 for payment calculations because the monthly payment amounts will vary for all other interest calculation types such as 360/Actual or 365/Actual. In these scenarios or any other scenario where an exact amount cannot be determined through computation the documents will identify that [X] months of payments will be reserved from the loan proceeds leaving the calculation to the lender/servicer.

interestReserveMinimum.title: Minimum Interest Reserve Balance
interestReserveMinimum.usage: CLIENT SPECIFIC. Only needed if interestReserve == 'Dollar Amount' || interestReserve == 'Monthly Payments'.

isHalfPayment.title: Use the Debt Service Reserve for one-half of payment?

isTaxReserve.title: Property Tax Reserve?
isTaxReserve.description: The lender will withhold funds from the loan proceeds in the amount entered to be used to pay property taxes through the **Maturity Date** of the loan. The Borrrower is required to pay property taxes first and can then seek these funds to be released from the loan servicer.

isPropertyInsuranceReserve.title: Property Insurance Reserve
isPropertyInsuranceReserve.description: The lender will withhold funds from the loan proceeds in the amount entered to be used to pay property insurance through the **Maturity Date** of the loan. The Borrrower is required to pay property insurance first and can then seek these funds to be released from the loan servicer.

isCapExReserve.title: Capital Expenditure Reserve
isCapExReserve.description: A Capital Expenditure Reserve (aka CapEx) is typically used for multifamily and/or commercial real estate loans. It's money set aside specifically to pay for things like buying new equipment or making major repairs or improvements to the property. Lenders sometimes require borrowers to create and fund a CapEx reserve as a way to ensure that the property stays in good shape and continues to be a good investment. If this option is selected, a borrower may request funds once per month from the borrower for these purposes.

isAppraisalReserve.title: Appraisal Reserve
isAppraisalReserve.description: This is used if the lender is relying on an After Repair Value (ARV), and an appraisal will not be completed prior to close. The reserve funds will be released to the borrower assuming the borrower has obtained an appraisal showing the minimum ARV meets or exceeds the amount determined by the user.  If not, Lender may retain the portion of the reserve necessary to keep the ARV ratio below 70%.

defaultReserve.title: Default Reserve?
defaultReserve.usage: Optional; sending no answer is functionally equivalent to answering 'None'.
defaultReserve.description: Selecting 'Yes' will add language to the loan documents so that in the event that your borrower defaults on the loan, the lender has the right to use the reserved funds to cover the costs of a) making required interest payments, b) making protective advances, or c) paying down the principal amount. If the lender uses or exhausts the funds, the lender can demand that the borrower replenish the Default Reserve. If they fail to replenish the default reserve, it is considered an additional event of default.

isOccupancyReserve.title: Occupancy Reserve?
isOccupancyReserve.description: If the borrower intends to vacate tenants from the collateral property in order to add value to said property, the lender can withhold funds from the loan proceeds at the time of funding. If the tenants vacate the property, and surrender possession of the property back to the owner, prior to the date entered by the user, these funds will be delivered to the borrower.

isGeneralReserve.title: Lender General Reserve?
isGeneralReserve.description: Using this feature will insert the following language into Section 2 of the Loan Agreement:  Out of the loan proceeds, Lender shall withhold the sum of [AMOUNT] Dollars ($00.00) as a Lender Holdback ('Lender Holdback').  Lender shall release the Lender Holdback once Borrower provides evidence of the receipt of [INSERT CONDITIONS] to the satisfaction of Lender.  Evidence shall include but not be limited to paid invoices, documentation of the issuance of the [INSERT CONTENT], and any other documentation required by Lender.  Borrower understands, acknowledges, and agrees that Lender will not disburse funds in excess of the Lender Holdback.  In its sole discretion, Lender may use the Lender Holdback to protect its Security Instrument or to pay down the principal amount owed under the Loan.  Should Borrower fail to receive the [CONDITION] as required by Lender, Lender reserves the right, and Borrower authorizes Lender, to take all corrective actions necessary, including but not limited to, contacting the City of [EXAMPLE CITY] to issue the [CERTIFICATE OF OCCUPANCY OR OTHER CONDITION].

isImprovementReserve.title: Tenant Improvement Reserve?
isImprovementReserve.description: A Tenant Improvement Reserve (aka TI Reserve) is typically used for commercial real estate loans.  It's money set aside specifically for tenant improvement projects or updates the borrower (as a landlord) is obligated to complete for their tenant.  If this option is selected, a borrower may request funds once per month from the lender for these purposes.

perDiemDelivery.title: Per Diem Interest Payable and Delivered to

otherFees.title: Fees paid to anyone other than a broker or lender

isPropertyManagement.title: Assignment of Property Management Agreement
isPropertyManagement.description: Selecting 'Yes' will create a new document for the borrower, lender, and property manager to sign which, among other things, requires the property manager to agree that their fees owed by borrower are junior in priority to the borrower's payments under the loan.

propertyManagement.title: Assignments of Property Management Agreement
propertyManagement.description: This array collects the properties for which an Assignment is to be made.

usesScheduleOfProperties.title: Uses Schedule of Properties
usesScheduleOfProperties.usage: This property is ignored by the interpreter. It can optionally be sent as 'true' to prompt validation functions using the final validation schema to validate the correct properties within this object.

propertySelect.title: Select Property for this Assignment
propertySelect.usage: Give the Property ID (APN) of the collateral property for which you want an Assignment of Property Management Agreement. Used when isScheduleOfProperties != true.

propertyAddress.title: Give Address for the Property for this Assignment
propertyAddress.usage: Address for the collateral property for which this Assignment is to be made. Only used isScheduleOfProperties == true.

isW9Guarantors.title: Include a W9 for each Guarantor?

isThirdPartyAffiliate.title: Third Party Affiliate?
isThirdPartyAffiliate.usage: Use of this property should be combined with enableFeatures.enableThirdPartyAffiliate == true

firstPaymentAmount.title: First Payment Amount (this includes any monthly impounds)

isUseFirstPayment.title: Use this amount (less monthly impounds, if any) wherever the initial payment amount appears?

isLoanSale.title: Is this loan intended for sale?

saleType.title: When will the loan be sold?

assignee.title: Select the loan purchaser or select 'Other' to enter the loan purchaser name(s) and address manually, or leave blank and a blank Assignment and Allonge will be produced.
assignee.usage: Possible answers vary by user. Check the relevant question on the Lightning Docs form for options, or contact Lightning Docs support. 'Other' may be used to give an assignee name and address using the properties below.

isCollateralAssignment.title: Change Assignment of Loan to a Collateral Assignment of Loan?
isCollateralAssignment.description: Select 'Yes' if you are anticipating the sale and assignment of the loan to an investor **which loan will be used as collateral** for an underlying obligation between the seller (assignor) and the purchaser (assignee). This option is typically used when the loan is being assigned to a warehouse lender and the Assignment is not being made as a 'true' assignment of the loan but rather solely for collateral purposes.

collateralDate.title: Assignee Loan Documents Date
collateralDate.usage: Only used if saleType == 'Concurrent' && isCollateralAssignment == true.

isAssignmentResale.title: Include additional Assignment and Allonge for future assignment by Assignee?

isAssigneeUsingMers.title: Insert MERS language for this purchaser?
isAssigneeUsingMers.description: This will enable the purchaser / assignee of this loan to enter this loan into MERS after assignment. The lender of assignee must still submit the final documents to MERS after loan closing.  The field to enter a MIN is only available here if the MERS selection in the Standard Loan Terms section is set to 'No'. Otherwise, the MIN entered in *that* section will control.

assigneeMersNumber.title: Assignee MERS MIN Number
assigneeMersNumber.description: Only needed if isAssigneeUsingMers == true && loan.isMERS == false.

isLoanSubordination.title: Produce Loan Subordination Agreement / Intercreditor Agreement?
isLoanSubordination.description: Select 'Yes' to include a Loan Subordination Agreement.  This document specifies that your loan is either senior or junior to another loan whether the other loan already exists or is closing around the time of your loan.  You may further choose between language types that are either more friendly to a senior lender or more friendly to a junior lender.

loanSubordination.title: Loan Subordination / Intercreditor Agreement Information
loanSubordination.description: This array collects the information for a Loan Subordination.

items.description: This object contains the attributes for the property for which a Loan Subordination is to be made.

usesScheduleOfProperties.title: Uses Schedule of Properties
usesScheduleOfProperties.usage: This property is ignored by the interpreter. It can optionally be sent as 'true' to prompt validation functions using the final validation schema to validate the correct properties within this object.

propertySelect.title: Select Property for this Loan Subordination
propertySelect.usage: Give the Property ID (APN) of the collateral property for which you want a Loan Subordination and Intercreditor Agreement. Used when isScheduleOfProperties != true.

propertyAddress.title: Give Address for the Property for this Loan Subordination
propertyAddress.usage: Address for the collateral property for which this Loan Subordination is to be made. Only used if isScheduleOfProperties == true.

subordinateLenders.title: Subordinate Lenders
subordinateLenders.description: This array collects the information for the subordinate lenders.

investedAmount.title: Invested Amount
investedAmount.usage: The sum of this amount over all Subordinate Lenders should equal debtAmount.

isAKA.title: Do any individuals require Signature Affidavit and AKA Statement?

akaInformation.title: Enter all individuals who require an AKA
akaInformation.description: This array collects the AKAs for individuals.

name.title: Select Individual [Give the name for whom the Signature Affidavit is to be made]

isBorrowerCertification.title: Include Borrower Release of Data Form?
isBorrowerCertification.description: Select 'Yes' to include a 'Borrower Certification and Authorization' form.  This document requires the borrower to certify that they understand lender may verify any information provided to it. Lender can share information with third parties including investors. The borrower also authorizes the sharing of this information and to receive phone, text, and email communications.

referrerName.title: Enter Referrer's Name
referrerName.usage: CLIENT SPECIFIC. Only used if isReferralFeeDisclosure == true.

isRemoveArbitration.title: Remove Arbitration Provisions?
isRemoveArbitration.usage: Use of this property should be combined with enableFeatures.enableRemoveArbitration == true
isRemoveArbitration.description: The standard loan documents include a requirement for mandatory arbitration for any type of claim other than the foreclosure of the property which must be performed as required under the mortgage/deed of trust. By selecting 'Yes' to this question, the user can remove the Arbitration Agreement as well as all references to mandatory arbitration for claims other than foreclosure.  Even though the arbitration is considered mandatory, more often than not the parties still choose to use the court process and only use the Arbitration language to further protect the lender by threatening the borrower to move all claims to an arbitration.  We recommend consulting with counsel prior to removing Arbitration language.

isRemoveLanguageCapacity.title: Remove English Language Capacity Declaration?
isRemoveLanguageCapacity.usage: Use of this property should be combined with enableFeatures.enableRemoveLanguageCapacity == true
isRemoveLanguageCapacity.description: The default loan documents include a Language Capacity Declaration which requires each signer of the loan documents to prove that they are fluent in the english language by hand-writing a short statement to that effect.  Selecting this option **removes** this document.  **Using this feature provides LESS legal protection than the default loan documents.**

isRemoveInitialLines.title: Remove initial lines from document footers?
isRemoveInitialLines.usage: Use of this property should be combined with enableFeatures.enableRemoveInitials == true
isRemoveInitialLines.description: By default, the Loan Agreement, Promissory Note, and Mortgage include initial lines in the footers of the documents for the parties to initial each page to establish the documents as true originals.  Selecting this option removes these initial lines at the bottom of the pages of these documents.  **Using this feature provides LESS legal protection than the default loan documents.**

isRemoveEntityCertificates.title: Remove All Entity Certificates?
isRemoveEntityCertificates.usage: Use of this property should be combined with enableFeatures.enableRemoveCertificates == true
isRemoveEntityCertificates.description: An Entity Certificate is a document that each party which is an entity or trust will sign along with the other loan documents which sets forth certain additional representations about their authority to enter into and sign the loan documents.  Selecting this feature will exclude these certificates.  **Using this feature will provide LESS legal protection than the default loan documents.**

isIncludeEntityDocs.title: Attach Entity Documents exhibit to entity certificates?
isIncludeEntityDocs.description: Attaches an exhibit to each produced entity documents so that relevant entity formation documents can be incorporated into the certificates

isIncludeCoverpage.title: Include Coverpage for documents that require initials or completion?
isIncludeCoverpage.usage: Use of this property should be combined with enableFeatures.enableSignerWarning == true
isIncludeCoverpage.description: Certain documents require initials between paragraphs within the document such as the Loan Agreement, Note, and Mortgage/Deed of Trust.  Other documents require the borrower complete the document in their own handwriting such as the Certificate of Non-Owner Occupancy, Business Purpose Certificate, and Language Capacity Declaration.  Selecting this feature will insert a coverpage to these documents alerting the notary that these documents cannot just be signed but additional entries in the documents must be done.

isIncludeMasterGuaranty.title: Include Reference to a Master Guaranty (see ?)
isIncludeMasterGuaranty.description: It is unlikely you need this feature.  This is only to be used if you have a Master Guaranty that has been signed by your guarantor in advance where they have agreed to guaranty multiple loans in a single guaranty.  Contact Lightning Docs support for more info.

isNoFillNonOwnerOccupancy.title: Use no-fill Certification of Non-Owner Occupancy?
isNoFillNonOwnerOccupancy.usage: Use of this property should be combined with enableFeatures.enableNoFillCertNonOwner == true
isNoFillNonOwnerOccupancy.description: The loan documents ordinarily come with a Certification of Non-Owner Occupancy that requires the borrower to hand-write their primary residence address into the certification and certify that the collateral property is not their primary residence.  This is done to provide better evidence the borrower does not and will not live in the property.  Selecting this option allows you to remove the hand written requirement in which the borrower will only need to sign and not fill-in the form.  **Using this option provides LESS legal protection than the default documents.**

isNoFillBusinessPurpose.title: Use no-fill Business Purpose of Loan Certification?
isNoFillBusinessPurpose.usage: Use of this property should be combined with enableFeatures.enableNoFillBusinessPurpose == true
isNoFillBusinessPurpose.description: The loan documents ordinarily come with a Certification of Business Purpose that requires the borrower to hand-write how they will use the loan proceeds and certify that none of the proceeds are to be used for any consumer purposes into the certification.  This is done to provide better evidence the borrower is not using the loan funds for an impermissible purpose.  Enabling this option allows the user to remove the hand-written requirement and instead make the form into a form that the borrower only needs to sign and not complete.  **Using this option provides LESS legal protection than the default documents.**

isExcludeLCI.title: Exclude the Lender's Closing Instructions?
isExcludeLCI.usage: Optional when at least one collateral property is in New York.

occupancyLeasedByDate.title: Date by which Percentage of Units to be Leased

occupancyDeadlines.title: Occupancy requirements and deadlines
occupancyDeadlines.description: This array collects the occupancy rate deadlines.

deadlineDate.title: Date by which that amount must be leased

unitSaleRequirements.title: Unit Sale Requirements
unitSaleRequirements.description: This array collects the components of a unit sale.

percent.title: Percent of Units to be Sold

rentRollReportDate.title: Date of first Rent Roll Report

isCashCollateral.title: Require Borrower to provide cash collateral?

isCSA.title: Create Collateral Security Agreement(s)?
isCSA.usage: Use of this property should be combined with enableFeatures.enableUCC == true
isCSA.description: In addition to the real property as collateral, some lenders may want to require the borrower or another debtor to provide personal property collateral for the loan.  For example, a loan secured by a car wash would likely want all of the equipment related to the car wash to be provided as additional collateral and the owner of that equipment should provide a collateral security interest in the car wash equipment.

debtorSelect.title: Identify Debtor
debtorSelect.usage: Can be used to select a debtor from among the entity borrowers, guarantors, and nonBorrowerOwners. Use of this property obviates the need for debtorName, debtorType, debtorState, and debtorSigner.

debtorSigner.title: Enter Name(s) and Title(s) of Parties Who Sign on behalf of the Entity being pledged

collateralType.title: Type of UCC Filing
collateralType.description: Select: 'blanket' for a Blanket UCC filing, 'other' to enter a list of specific personal property, 'both' to do both of the above, and 'custom' to attach a custom list or exhibit to the UCC filing.

mininumBalance.title: Account Minimum Balance
mininumBalance.description: Minimum account balance, required if collateralType == 'bank'

personalProperty.title: Enter Specific Personal Property
personalProperty.usage: Only needed if collateralType == 'other' or collateralType == 'both'.
personalProperty.description: This array collects items of specific personal property.

isAdditionalUCC.title: Record additional UCC in Property Records?
isAdditionalUCC.description: Normally UCC filings are only filed in the UCC state records in the state in which the debtor is incorporated for entities, or is a resident of for individuals. Some lenders prefer to *also* record a UCC in the property records even though this is technically not necessary to notify third parties of a valid UCC interest in personal property.

additionalUCC.title: Identify which properties to record an additional UCC against
additionalUCC.description: This array collects the information of properties for which you want to record an additional UCC against.

isEquityPledgeAgreement.title: Create Equity Pledge Agreement(s)?
isEquityPledgeAgreement.usage: Use of this property should be combined with enableFeatures.enableUCC == true
isEquityPledgeAgreement.description: An Equity Pledge is used when the Lender wants the ownership of an entity (_i.e. membership interests of an LLC, shareholder interests of a corporation, limited partnership interests of a Limited Partnership_) to be pledged as additional collateral in addition to the real estate.  The party pledging the interest can be the borrower, guarantor or other party related to the loan transaction, or they can be an unrelated third party.  An Equity Pledge is commonly referred to as a 'membership pledge' (because more often than not the entity being pledged is an LLC and thereby the member interests are being pledged), or a 'Pledge of Equity'. These are all synonyms for the fact that the ownership of the business is being pledged as additional collateral in addition to the real estate.

equityPledgeAgreement.title: Equity Pledge Agreements
equityPledgeAgreement.description: This array collects the information for each Equity Pledge Agreement.

entitySelect.title: Entity Being Pledged
entitySelect.usage: Can be used to select a debtor from among the entity borrowers. Use of this property obviates the need for all other properties in this object (entityName, entityType, entityState, signers, and owners). borrowers.complexOwners.formationState must be provided even for owners who are individuals.

signers.title: Enter Name(s) and Title(s) of Parties Who Sign on behalf of the Entity being pledged

owners.title: Enter Owners (Members, Shareholders or Limited Partners) of Entity Being Pledged

isAcknowledgeComplianceWarnings.title: I (i) acknowledge and understand the impact of each of the notices above, (ii) have taken all actions necessary to ensure that your loan and its terms are compliant, and (iii) would like to proceed with the loan terms as indicated in this interview.
